title: How to Catch a Stringfish in Animal Crossing

steps.headline: Wait for the right time.
steps.description: The Stringfish only appears in winter, from December to February, and only between 4PM and 9AM. In Animal Crossing New Horizons, the Stingfish can be found between 4PM to 9AM in December through March in the Northern Hemisphere. In the Southern Hemisphere, it's found between 4PM to 9AM in June through September. If you really want a Stringfish, and it’s not the right time in the real world, you could always do Time Travel (i.e., manually change the date of your Animal Crossing town) in order to make it the right time.

steps.headline: Get a fishing rod.
steps.description: In most games, you can purchase a fishing rod from Tom Nook or Timmy. In Animal Crossing New Horizons, you can craft a flimsy fishing rod from 5 tree branches using the crafting table.

steps.headline: Go to the right place.
steps.description: The Stringfish is found in rivers. In Animal Crossing New Horizon, Stingfish are only found in the clifftop river. It's the highest water source on your island at the top of the waterfalls. You will need to use the ladder to climb to the top.

steps.headline: Equip the fishing rod.
steps.description: To equip the fishing rod, open your inventory and select it. Then select Hold.

steps.headline: Look for a big shadow of a fish.
steps.description: The shadow that the Stringfish makes in the water is bigger than the shadow that other fish make. If you want to save yourself the time of simply catching every fish in the river, just look for the big shadow. To help you save time, run along the side of the river if you only see small shadows. Running will scare away the small fish, and waiting a short bit of time will result in new, different fish populating the river. Rinse and repeat until you see that large shadow that you’re looking for. In Animal Crossing New Horizons, craft fish bait from manilla clams at the crafting table. Use it at the clifftop river to increase your chances of finding a stingfish.

steps.headline: Press A to cast your line in front of the fish.
steps.description: Try to aim so that it lands in front of the huge shadow. This will make it easier for the fish to see the bait.

steps.headline: Wait for the fish to bite.
steps.description: Most of the time, the fish will nibble a few times first before you’ve fully hooked the fish. Watch the bobber and wait for the fish to pull it under the water. The bite can also be determined by the plunking sound it makes, so turn your volume all the way.

steps.headline: Press A to reel the fish in.
steps.description: When you see the fish pull the bobber below the water, press "A" immediately to reel it in. Pressing “A” too early will just result in the fish getting away.
